key_points: Tiger Woods filmed a miniseries teaching celebrities golf the day before his rollover car crash in California.
The series, 'A Round with Tiger: Celebrity Lessons,' features celebrities like Jada Pinkett Smith, David Spade, and Dwyane Wade.
Filmed in February, the day before Woods' accident, the series was released with his and his guests' blessing.
Woods discusses the challenges of aging and the impact on his body in the premiere episode with Jada Pinkett Smith.
Woods has undergone 11 major surgeries, including an emergency surgery for his February 23 car accident injuries.
Dwyane Wade spoke about his shock at Woods' accident and expressed hopes for Woods' recovery and return to golf.
Tiger Woods described the recovery from his car crash as 'more painful than anything I have ever experienced.'
The Los Angeles County Sheriff determined speed was the primary cause of Woods' accident with no impairment signs, and Woods wasn't cited.
Woods focuses on his recovery and appreciates the support received during his difficult time.
'A Round with Tiger: Celebrity Playing Lessons' airs Tuesdays on Golf Digest through August 10.
